item.title: Interpersonal Dehumanization
item.description:
Status: planning follow-up. Look for my poster at SPSP 2020!

We’ve run two studies testing whether we can manipulate perceptions of humanity with simple trait descriptions. We’ve found that our manipulation succeeds in making our targets less human, and that this predicts less attribution of pain (above), greater punishment, and more painful medical decision-making. However, we’ve also been manipulating targets’ race, but that has no effect. We are attempting to disentangle whether individual and group sources of dehumanization override one another or combine.
